comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: Initial patch with bare bones implementation of getMetaData and getCatalog. The new class DatabaseMetaDataImpl only has the constructor implemented. The other methods are just the default placeholders generated by IntelliJ.

comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: Tests need to be added for this and solve just the two errors above. With this, DBVisualizer now connects. DBVisualizer throws warnings about certain metadata not populated and this will be addressed in a separate JIRA to make reviewing easier.

comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: Fixed DatabaseMetaDataImpl to be package private for ctor and class based on comment from SOLR-8513.

comments.author: Joel Bernstein
comments.content:
Ok, this basically the skeleton for the DatabaseMetaDataImpl, so I think it's ready to commit as is.

Kevin Risden, any issues with making this the first commit for the JDBC tickets?

comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: Joel Bernstein - No issues. This ticket should be the first to commit since others depend on it.

comments.author: Joel Bernstein
comments.content: I'm not quite sure how to handle the CHANGES.txt for the JDBC commits. Possibly list the bigger features and leave the interim steps off the list.

comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: Hmmm the incremental changes don't really mean all that much to be honest. I just wanted to split them up so they were easier to review.  Putting them all together to get a SQL client to work is important. I think the intermediate ones should go relatively smooth. Maybe just add to the changelog when get down to SOLR-8521 and it works with a SQL client?

comments.author: Kevin Risden
comments.content: actually why not add the changelog when SOLR-8502 is closed when all the subtasks are complete?

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit 1724721 from Joel Bernstein in branch 'dev/trunk'
